meanings.definition: Not able to be reached or entered.
meanings.sent1: The top shelf was inaccessible to the little girl.
meanings.sent2: The cave was inaccessible due to a large boulder blocking the entrance.
meanings.sent3: The cookie jar was placed in an inaccessible spot, teasing the children.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like an inaccessible fortress, guarded against any intrusion.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest lay at the bottom of the ocean, its contents inaccessible to all.

meanings.definition: Difficult or impossible to reach or obtain.
meanings.sent1: The rare flower was inaccessible to most collectors.
meanings.sent2: The summit of the mountain was inaccessible without proper climbing gear.
meanings.sent3: The key to the locked door seemed to be in an inaccessible location.
meanings.sent4: His dreams of becoming an astronaut felt as inaccessible as the stars themselves.
meanings.sent5: The ancient artifact was stored in an inaccessible chamber deep within the tomb.

meanings.sent1: The complex math problem was inaccessible to the students without guidance.
meanings.sent2: The artist's abstract painting was inaccessible to some viewers.
meanings.sent3: The cat's aloof behavior made it seem inaccessible to the new owner.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like an inaccessible maze, confusing and hard to navigate.
meanings.sent5: The ancient language on the tablet was inaccessible to modern translators.
